review.reviewBody: She loves the look at fit, but there’s a defect in the zipper that has over time made it non-functional.  Such a disappointment.
review.name: Bad zipper, warm coat

review.reviewBody: Great stylish jacket for all snow days. This jacket is in the medium range of weight but keeps my daughter warm. It’s not too heavy but also not too light. We used the size chart recommended on the website but I think these jackets run a littler big. I had to return my original size for 2 sizes smaller. I do have petit girls but it seemed big.
review.name: Stylish

hasVariant.name: Base 4.0 Legging - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Under Armour Base 4.0 Legging - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The Under Armour base layer are the best thermals on the market!
review.name: The best thermals on the market!

review.reviewBody: These leggings are very warm and great for watching football games in the winter.
review.name: Great leggings!

review.reviewBody: The best cold weather gear I have gotten yet!
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: I always like UA leggings to keep me warm in the winter. However, these "leggings" are not like the leggings I have purchased in the past. These are not form fitting "leggings" it is a loose fit and wider around the ankles. I am overall disappointed with my purchase. I will be doing a return.
review.name: The actual Fit is not like the Photo
comment: We are very sorry these leggings were not meeting your expectations. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback and have forwarded your review to our Product Development Team for examination.

review.reviewBody: These tights work great as a base layer. Out hiking in 6* F weather. Work great under hiking pants. I wish they were a little longer. I’m 6ft tall and I have to stretch them out of the wash. Otherwise perfect.
review.name: Awesome thermal protection!!!

review.reviewBody: truly a must have warmer if you are a skier or like to be in cold weather! I had used these for years and I am so happy with them!!! Just buy! true to size, I am usually a XS/small and got a small on these.
review.name: My fav for skiing!!!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the best base layer I've ever worn. I'm always cold. I can sit in a 69-degree house and not freeze but not sweat when it’s 74 degrees either. Outdoors at 20 degrees, I was toasty warm.
review.name: Da Bomb

review.reviewBody: I got these to replace an old pair of the same style (base 4.0).  On the positive, the waist is much higher than the older style, but everything else about them is horrible.  They’re super long and from the knee down they’re baggy.  These aren’t leggings at all.  They also are cut overall much larger than my old pair- they fit almost an entire size bigger.
review.name: Very poor fit
comment: We are very sorry these leggings were not meeting your expectations all around. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with this feedback and have forwarded your review to our Product Development Team for examination.

review.reviewBody: The Under Armour Base 4.0 Leggings have become my go-to choice for workouts and cold-weather activities.
review.name: Top-Notch Leggings: Under Armour Base 4.0

review.reviewBody: Warm, thick, and Quality Baselayer bottom.  It just 2 inches longer than most brand.  I hope that you can me the bottom inches shorter.  It would fit me perfectly.  Great product!
review.name: Warm, thick, and Quality Baselayer bottom!

name: Base 4.0 Legging - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my son - college student doing a lot of outdoor walking to classes.  This coat is keeping him from getting cold!
review.name: Warm and Toasty

review.reviewBody: Package was delivered on time but Backcountry does not account for stolen or lost items. Attempting to get help from customer service, a man repeated the same phrase over the phone as soon as package was notified as stolen.
review.name: Delivered on time, poor customer service

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased this parka, and I couldn't be happier with it! The quality is outstanding, with durable materials and excellent stitching. It keeps me incredibly warm, even in freezing temperatures, thanks to its superior insulation. The design is both functional and stylish, with plenty of pockets and a flattering fit. I also appreciate the attention to detail, like the adjustable hood and cuffs, which help block out the wind. This parka is perfect for anyone who needs a reliable, cozy, and good-looking winter coat. Highly recommend.
review.name: I would recommend the product.

review.reviewBody: The jacket is undeniably warm and comfortable; however, I was quite disappointed right from the very first day of wearing it. Unfortunately, I noticed that fluff started coming out, which was not something I expected from this product.
review.name: I wouldn't buy this jacket again

review.reviewBody: Solid jacket. Keeps you warm no matter how cold the temperature is.
review.name: 100% recommend this product

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! It's exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Great buy

review.reviewBody: I live in north central Mt. It gets below 0 with wind. This coat will keep me warm. I am a little concerned about the lack of a drawcord at the waist but with the length just below my butt I am not to worried. Fits comfortably and seems very well made. Lots of well designed pockets. Got an xl, and fits well.
review.name: Very warm parka

review.reviewBody: Got this for my 11 year old in Middle school! Coat is amazing! Super warm! We live in Vermont so below freezing is a normal day. This coat is perfect for our mountain winters
review.name: I'd certainly buy again

review.reviewBody: Best coat I've ever owned! This will put any chilly day to the test. Fits comfortably, plenty of pockets, and the fur hood lining looks great and keeps well in the weather! Jacket is true to size, I'm a M-L, ordered a size Medium, and I'm glad I did because I would have been engulfed in a Large. 5/5, would recommend.
review.name: Favorite coat of my life

review.reviewBody: The NorthFace jacket was as described. However, I will only order from you as a last resort. Several years ago I received a pair of Uggs from you with a bad area of leather that my daughter put her finger through while putting them on. They were worn twice. You didn’t believe me and sent them back without exchanging them. I have not forgotten and only ordered the jacked because I couldn’t find  the size elsewhere.
review.name: Nice jacket as last resort

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, after only two uses, the zipper on the coat broke off. I have been advised by the company to submit a warranty claim, but I am uncertain how long this process will take,especially given the current cold weather and my grandson's urgent need for appropriate outerwear. As a result, I will need to purchase an alternative coat; however, I will be reconsidering my investment, as I did not expect a product priced over $120 to fail so soon.
review.name: I would not buy again

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Boys' Reversible Perrito Hooded Jacket for my son, and I couldn't be more pleased with this choice! This jacket has quickly become a staple in his wardrobe, and here's why: Versatile Style One of the standout features of this jacket is its reversible design. With two stylish options, my son can easily switch between a bold color and a more subdued look, allowing him to express his personality while staying warm. It's perfect for various occasions, whether he's heading to school or out for a weekend adventure. Exceptional Warmth The insulation provided by Heatseeker Eco is impressive. Even on chilly days, this jacket keeps my son warm without being bulky. He can play outside for hours without feeling cold, which is a huge plus for any parent! Comfort and Fit The jacket features raglan sleeves that provide excellent mobility, making it easy for him to run, jump, and play without restriction. The hood is also a great addition, offering extra protection against the wind and cold. The fit is true to size, so I recommend following the sizing chart when ordering. Durability I appreciate that this jacket is made from recycled materials and has a water-repellent finish. It stands up well to rough play and light rain, which is essential for an active child. After several washes, it still looks as good as new, with no signs of wear. Final Thoughts Overall, the Boys' Reversible Perrito Hooded Jacket is an excellent investment for any parent looking for a stylish, warm, and durable jacket for their child. My son loves wearing it, and I love knowing he's comfortable and protected from the elements. I highly recommend this jacket to anyone in need of quality outerwear!
review.name: Review of the Boys' Reversible Perrito Hooded Jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket is great! Warm and reversible, as mentioned !
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: This coat was huge! I'm sure that it keeps a person warm, but it needed to be returned because the sizing was off.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: I purchase a new North Face coat for each of my grandkids every year for Christmas - love them!
review.name: Love North Face - always cozy and warm!

review.reviewBody: Amazing quality as always! My 12 year old loves it!! Keeps him super warm without being too puffy
review.name: We buy this coat every year!!

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. So warm and soft. Son didn't want to take it off! We love the khaki color. Reversible. Love the attached hood. True to size.
review.name: Amazing jacket. True to size

review.reviewBody: Well my kids love there jacket and it keeps them real warm and comfortable
review.name: I will always buy then north face jackets

review.reviewBody: This coat fits my son perfectly. He is 5'4 and about 100lbs. It's warm but not bulky. My son really likes the style of this coat. He wanted one with a hood. It also matches his Northface backpack. It's probably not a coat for skiing but will be perfect to wear to school this fall/winter.
review.name: Good Quality and stylish

name: Reversible Perrito Hooded Jacket - Boys'

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my third pair of shoe and they fit me just so and provide enough support. Comfortable right out of the box for me.  Nice wide toe box and snug all else.
review.name: Fit right. Support right

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the new Spring Bridger!  The fit is definitely much more narrow and slightly shorter than the insulated winter version.  I find the smaller fit to be a little less clumsy, though it is a smidge short on my bigger foot- but not too crowded.  I highly recommend Oboz for their stellar arch support, and now I’m really pleased that they have a style that works for low-volume narrow feet.  The Bridger series seem not to be as wide.  As an aside, I also have the Sphynx from Oboz, and it is also a great option for narrow feet!
review.name: Narrow, Low-volume feet REJOICE!

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots so much and am going to order another pair,  They were immediately comfortable out of the box and didn't require time to break them in.  I ordered a 1/2 size larger than my regular shoe size and they're perfect.   I wear them hiking on very rocky and rough terrain almost weekly (for months now) and they've been holding up really well.   I wonder if the other reviewer had a defective pair because I'm not seeing any issues with the tread peeling back on mine.
review.name: Durable and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Went on one hike with the shoe, already starting to come apart at the bottoms. The rubber tread is already peeling back. Had bruises on my ankles from how stiff the hightops are. Very clunky and heavy. I wear a size 7 but got a 7.5. They are still too small.
review.name: Uncomfortable, Stiff, & Ripping

name: Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
Bridger Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Hydro 2L Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to combine with my Gregory alpine pack and the first thing I noticed is the hose is designed to come up the left side but the integrated shoulder sleeve is on the right side of the backpack.  Even with this cross over there was too much hose, which would be fine, I managed to make it work.  However, upon first use on the mountain, the plastic insert from the mouth piece into the hose broke from what I can only assume was pressure from the hose being too long or the plastic being brittle. I leaned over to strap in my bindings and water was spewing all over.  If I had been in the backcountry this would have been terrible.
review.name: Not a great experience!
comment: Thanks for leaving your review.  Sorry to hear about the issue you experienced.  Please reach out to our customer service team so we can discuss next steps.

review.reviewBody: This is an excellent water reserve!  I really like the valve on this one.
review.name: Excellent Water Reserve

name: Hydro 2L Reservoir

hasVariant.name: SA-3 Heavy Duty Shop Apron
hasVariant.description: Buy the Park Tool SA-3 Heavy Duty Shop Apron online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just used my SA-3 for the first time yesterday while greasing, lubing, cleaning and getting otherwise dirty. Would most certainly have permanently stained my clothes doing these tasks were it not for the apron. I had some concern that the cotton would not prevent grease stains, and was considering going for a waxed canvas apron instead, but this thing is thick enough that it wasn't a problem. As the other reviewer points out, the pockets are useful, though I do wish they were a bit more compartmentalized, including one for a cell phone, as I found my tools getting lost and floating around in the bigger ones. I'm also tall (6'3) and the apron does not make it down to my knees, which leaves some shorts exposure below. It would likely fit most other people quite well. Given the quality of the fabric and the pockets, it's a no brainer to spring the extra few bucks for the SA-3 over the standard Park Tool apron.
review.name: Great investment: go for the heavy duty

name: SA-3 Heavy Duty Shop Apron

description: Buy the Ibis Logo Freehub Body online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Logo Freehub Body
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ibis Logo Freehub Body online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had bought this piece of equipment for my mountain bike, and because the wheels are from ibis the HG hub was ibis and I wanted to replace it with the said part and it’s a perfect fit. Backcountry gave me the ability to have the same parts same equipment from the same manufacturer. It was perfect thank you, Backcountry.
review.name: Backcountry/ ibis

review.reviewBody:
The beauty of Ibis logo hubs it the ability to switch free hubs and different cassettes. I bought my Ibis HD5 with a NX build to keep the price point down and leave it open for customizing. 
I picked this up to fit a GX cassette after adding the GX derailleur and shifter. Install was easy, remove the NX cassette, old driver, and add the new stuff. 
Points of engagement and free hub sound is the same. 
Easy way to swap out parts.
review.name: Ibis XD Free Hub

name: Logo Freehub Body

hasVariant.name: PCT 70L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear PCT 70L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought it for the everest base camp trek and it was a great choice. I saw a review below that mentioned the sleeping bag pocket was very small so I was kind of hesitant. When it came I was disappointed that the sleeping bag area at the bottom was indeed very very small, but there are two straps hidden inside the side bottle lockets that allow the bottom of the bag to be much much bigger. My lumina 15 sleeping bag fits perfectly at the bottom now! And still plenty of room in the other pockets for heat. Great design and very comfortable. The waist strap pockets are a bit tight though. Ita a really right squeeze to fit my Galaxy S21 into it as advertised in the promo video. It can be done, just have to squeeze it in. Great bag!
review.name: Lovely trekking pack

review.reviewBody: Took this pack into the bush, absolutely loved it. Really a quality product at a fair price. Despite the 70L size, I found it comfortable to wear and not too cumbersome. I would highly recommend it for hiking / portaging.
review.name: PCT 70L backpack

review.reviewBody: Just finished a three day trip in the Sierras and packed this full with tent, bear canister/food, clothes, fishing gear, sleeping mat, etc.  Couldn't believe how much gear this held.  Outside of being really heavy, it was comfortable.
review.name: Sierras

review.reviewBody: Very impressed with this pack. I needed something a little larger than my lightweight 58L back for an upcoming trip. I was a little hesitant due to the base weight difference, but absolutely satisfied with this pack.  It carries weight extremely well. I've had up to 45 lbs in it without discomfort.  The organization is fantastic. 3 compartments on the brain. Main section with bottomed access for sleep system. Outer pouch holds a lot of gear-perfect for rain gear and camp shoes, plus there's a zippered compartment. Side pockets swallow  2x 1L smart water bottles, and my camp chair fits in the other. Easy access to the side pockets with the pack on, with a slit for reinserting the water bottles. The only thing I'd wish for are pouches on the shoulder straps for bear spray or a phone. All in all, to many great features to list.  My new go-to pack for longer trips.
review.name: Thoughtful design and very comfortable.

review.reviewBody:
Bought this bag to get me through the west coast trail, haven't gone yet but in my preparation I have carried some heavy loads (3 climbing ropes, climbing hardware and some camera gear) no problem. Genuinely surprised at the comfort of the pack while hauling that much.
Large pockets and openings make it easy to load the pack to capacity and the front flap is great to be able to access specific items without having to take stuff off the top.
Only thing holding me from a perfect review is that I haven't gone on my trip yet and have only used it to haul gear to the crag :)
review.name: Great pack so far

review.reviewBody: I have taken this on 2 trips so far and love it.  I am a female but I bought this for the color and its been fine.  There is a surprise hydration bag inside that is removable and turns into a daypack!  it was such a delight to discover this.  My water leaked but the bag kept my clothes totally dry.
review.name: Surprise extra treat

review.reviewBody: The layout and org on this pack are amazing!  Love having access from the top as well as big panel zipper on the front of the pack.  Pockets in the lid and in the overflow are perfect for keeping everything you need for a week plus on the trail organized.  The load carry on this pack is great too.  Had it loaded up with over 50 pounds on the hike in to the base camp before climbing the Grand Teton and it carried comfortably with no hot spots or tension.  Stoked to have a new backpacking pack!
review.name: Big load hauler

review.reviewBody: After a few test runs with gear and a few adjustments, I got this bag to fit perfect. There's a perfect amount of pockets and space to store all your gear in.  The inside removable day bag came in pretty handy one night when we set up our base camp then hiked to a swimming spot.  The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the trekking pole holders, I tried watching the video on how to get them to work, and I think I kept doing it wrong.  Also once you get everything packed in and pulled tight, it was kinda difficult to get my water bottles out of the sides and pretty much impossible to put them back in alone.  I either had to have someone help or take my pack off.  Still, for the price, size, and features, I'd give it a solid 8.5/10
review.name: Tested in the Grand Tetons

review.reviewBody:
About me: 5'4 with long torso, 125 pounds, purchased M/L. AVID outdoor enthusiast and outdoor professional--meaning I use my pack for work all the time. I have thousands of miles under my belt (most being from weekend to extended 10 day trips). I expect my gear to be streamlined, durable, functional. I have high standards, as I love the Earth and want my investments to last (and not pile up in a landfill).

I bought this with excitement, as my 15 year old pack needs retirement. Having great success with the Mountain Hardwear BMG 105  (winter) pack, I thought this would be perfect for smaller loads in summer. Upon receiving it, I was extremely disappointed. Here's why:

Pros: 
*It fits like a glove. (See sizing above) Comfortable. I can tell it wouldn't need a break in period,, and makes the deal-breaking cons that much more of a bummer!

Cons: 
*Sleeping bag compartment? Last I checked, my sleeping bag is far bulkier than my 4 year old's blankie. It is abysmally small and compact. I can't imagine what I'd put in there. What a waste of space. The inability to fully open it to match the main compartments size is frustrating to say the least. It gives me the same feeling of when the car seat belt locks on me inappropriately. "This. Isn't. Supposed. To. Be. So. Tight!!!" Argh! To be clear, it's stitched in a way that the frame of the pack bulges into what should be the compartment, and is super tight on the frontside as well, as it seems they took space out of the bottom compartment to compensate for huge side pockets.... this creates a tight bottleneck to squeeze stuff though into the compartment only slightly larger than the bottleneck. You can see this in the photos. Why, MH? Why?? 

*Straps under sleeping bag compartment are too short to carry much of anything on bottom-outside when pack is loaded. Where will I put my tent? I like it bottom center for balance and lower weight load.

*Speaking of weight load...the stuff it pocket in front might be a quarter to a third of the bag's capacity. It sticks so far off the pack that it feels unbalanced. Not for me.

*Water bottle pockets: not super easy to use or convenient to retrieve/return when loaded. 

I gave it an "okay" on quality, since MH gear is usually tough and lasts, but quality of design on this bag (IMO) sucks. 

I don't usually leave reviews, but this is an honest one....those are becoming harder to suss out with all the 'bot reviews. This pack might be great for you, but it's not for me. Disappointed. 
(Also, tried to add photos but it isn't working. With my sleeping bag (up and down, because I sure can't squeeze it in that tiny bottle-necked compartment ) and bear canister in the main compartment, I have about 6" of space left.)
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: Perfect size perfect weight. Love these packs. They are tough as nails!
review.name: Best pack all around

name: PCT 70L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
The Fit sensor 2 is my favorite, but these are cut MUCH lower in the waist

ETA I meant the waist is cut lower in the front.
review.name: Lower cut

review.reviewBody: I have been riding for a few years in "affordable" liners/padded shorts.  As I increased my time in the saddle from 45min to 1.5 hrs or more, I was feeling the soreness.  Decided to spring for these shorts to see if spending more $ would help.  It did.  I feel a significant difference after riding in these shorts.  Not sore after my weekend warrior rides.  I cannot say how they feel after a 3 hour ride though.  I have to work up to that.  I hope this helps.
review.name: A good next step

review.reviewBody:
I did a Century Ride in these shorts their first Ride, no problem.  Their next Ride was a 6o mile Ride, I came away sore (can happen).  The next time was just 28 miles, I developed a saddle sore.  Put them away for a couple of weeks.  Using other shorts healed, never was bad thanks to Chamois Cream.  I decided to wear them yesterday on a 80 mile Ride, a start of a saddle sore.  Unfortunately, I now consider these $100 shorts a waste of money.  They seem to have ridges in the rear padding.
I DO NOT RECOMMEND
review.name: Great at first

review.itemreviewed: Legacy LTE Pull On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my daughter in Anchorage. She loves them and wonders how she survived without them.
review.name: Perfect for living in Anchorage

review.itemreviewed: Legacy LTE Pull On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These boots are perfect for sloppy weather.  Don't count on it for a warmer boot--it's fine in that department but not for freezing temps.  The lining tends to slide down no matter what type of sock is worn.  It takes more than a tug on the back strap to pull the lining back up, rather, a pull around the entire top of the boot needs to be tugged to straighten it out.  I ordered a half size up and that fit works for me.
I most likely would not select this style again.  I'd like something warmer as well as a non fussy liner.
review.name: Solid waterproof boot

review.itemreviewed: Legacy LTE Pull On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these for a recent move to a state that experiences freezes, rain and wind. I realized pretty soon I was going to need warm boots. I had just ordered a pair of these for my Mom and so asked her how she like them. She really likes them and sent a picture. Hers had to be exchanged for a half size up and so I ordered a half size up and they fit perfectly. Wore them many times it the frigid weather and my feet were always toasty! Highly recommend +++
review.name: Warm and toasty

review.itemreviewed: Legacy LTE Pull On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are great for mild winter days in cold, wet coastal CT. They look good and are surprisingly warm.  The fit was a bit small and with some heel slippage-but  I still sized up a 1/2 size so I could wear heavier darn toughs with them. They feel better and are really warm, are easy to slip on to walk the dog and do errands. And waterproof for wet rainy and snowy days!
review.name: Great boots for every day wear

review.itemreviewed: Legacy LTE Pull On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My feet are happy because they are warm and dry! I would definitely buy them again.
review.name: Perfect for cold feet and winter temperatures!!!!!
comment:
Jessica,
Thank you for the positive review! We hope you continue to be an Xtratuf supporter!

I bought them yesterday and I absolutely appreciate the fit and the look.  I wear a 8 and they fit perfect.  Very pleased with this purchase.  I have bought several pair of xtratuf women’s boots.  Functionality is what I look for and xtratuf boots meet the need.
Looking forward and hoping this boot comes in black in the future.

hasVariant.name: BC Link Mini
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Access BC Link Mini online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I swapped these in as an add to my radio set - I've gone from the OG link to the 2.0, to these now. And after spending all of last season on them, I can now say for certain that this radio is the best version and exactly what I need. 

I also had a set of rocky talkies, and while I have liked those radios, I have found these to be superior for a few reasons : 

- The mounting clips are super simple and easy to install on a backpack strap - and since I am usually setting the radio on the strap and leaving it there all day, I find that these interface cleaner than the Rockie Talkie carabiner and doesnt dangle as much while riding. It's super easy to hit the "talk" button and speak down into the radio. 

- The batter seems to last longer. They are essentially the same, but I've noticed that when using the BCA radio more often, it will last as long if not longer than the RT. 

- The shape and hand feel. Super ergonomic. 

- Adjusting the channels, while at first is not as intuitive, is super nice to have on the LCD and you can dial your CT in. 

- Range is great. I haven't had an issue on direct line of sight or even in mixed terrain. I've even been surprised to pick up my buddy's chatter, who uses the same base channel, when they are across the range. It's nice knowing I can get in contact from a distance. 

- The price point also doesn't hurt.
review.name: Amazing! love the range/battery life

review.reviewBody: I recently upgraded from the BCA link 1.0. I wanted the single unit to be able to switch channels quicker plus it's easier to switch between backpacks without the long cord. Lightweight, good battery, works as intended. After 4 or 5 tours, I would recommend.
review.name: Works Well So Far

review.reviewBody:
I've used my pair of these a couple times and have some initial observations.
I am happy with the size and weight. Lighter than my old motorola FRS radios. The controls feel solid and well made. Reception seems good in the field so far. Sound is good, but speaking right into the microphone causes some issues; hold the radio a bit away from your mouth helps. The units come with 2 types of clips and a leash which helps in different types of attachment points.

Only issues: small initial learning curve for programming the radio, but once you understand how to do it it's simple. I don't like the key lock feature not persisting if the radio is turned off and back on; you have to lock the keys again. The clip attachment on the back seems ok, but being all plastic, hope it doesn't break.

I haven't tested how long the battery lasts. The couple hours I have used them each time in the field hardly affected the battery life.
review.name: Nice radio

name: BC Link Mini

review.reviewBody:
It is an incredibly versatile backpack, perfect for a variety of outdoor adventures. Aside from the typically amazing comfort of Mystery Ranch’s harness system and the well-known quality, here’s what I particularly liked:
	•	Three Large Shovel Pockets: These add significant extra volume, and combined with the external loops and straps, extend the backpack’s usability from easy day hikes to light overnights.
	•	Impressive Compression System: The backpack has multiple additional attachment points, allowing you to move the compression straps around and customize the fit based on your load.
	•	Modular Organization: While it lacks internal organization (there’s no lid pocket or small item storage), it has three attachment points for Void Bags (two medium ones on the sides and one small on the top). Though the Void Bags are an additional cost, if you own several Mystery Ranch backpacks, they allow you to switch between packs without having to transfer small items—just move the Void Bag from one pack to another.
	•	Color Scheme: Black and Orange, of course .

Things I Didn’t Like:
	•	Belt Pockets: While the belt pockets are roomy, they’re not wide enough to fit my iPhone 14 (not Max). However, they are better and feel larger than the ones on the Bridger 45.
	•	Lid Pocket: I’d appreciate having a lid pocket for storing small essentials.
	•	Shoulder Strap Loops: An extra loop or two on the shoulder strap for routing a hydration hose would be a nice addition.

Overall, I think tRadix 31 is an excellent backpack for its size. It’s highly capable and versatile, with features that allow you to adapt it to a wide range of use cases. I can see this becoming my go-to companion for many future adventures.
review.name: My new go-to backpack

review.reviewBody: Pack is flexible and capable of holding for more than you think. 4 stars because I feel the lid would be better if it had storage like it’s two bigger counterparts.
review.name: Light and spacious.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Radix31 for hiking and camping trips in the Colorado Sangres, it's by far, the best pack I have ever owned. Extremely comfortable!
review.name: Perfect Pack

review.reviewBody: After trying out the Bridger 35 for I bit I opted for this pack because it was a familiar and comfortable yoke combined with a light weight construction. Of course only slightly smaller than the Bridger 35, I was sup surprised to see that the Radix 31 seemed to give me more usable space for the same load (odd?). Plus it has the outer pockets to carry the quick access items I wanted to stow. It’s still very comfortable but I do think the Bridger yoke is much more comfortable than this design. But it doesn’t have the chest pouches. Couple drawbacks of the Radix 32. It doesn’t have a top flap pouch! Why not?  And to get into the bag, although not difficult, it takes a few extra steps to completely unzip to gain access to the bottom of the bag. I’m planning to do the Tour du Mont Blanc with bag drops along the way this fall (no need to pack a tent, sleeping bag, etc.) so I needed a lightweight and comfortable bag to carry just the essentials for the day and a few extra items as needed. This bag fit the bill to be comfortable and light. I recommend.
review.name: Light Weight & Stylish

review.reviewBody: You have a choice, large cumbersome feeling pack or a smaller limited use pack. I want a moderate pack for hunting first and other use second. The bag configuration is another story.
review.name: Ok pack

review.reviewBody:
My first experience with Radix 31. I am happy. 
it is very easy and very comfortable for a hike of 13 km up to 1600 m.
review.name: Great features

review.reviewBody: I just got this pack today and haven't used it yet, but I'm in love already.  I can tell it will be really comfortable with heavy loads.  Love the hip belt pockets for easy access while hiking.  I also really like the outside compression straps in order to cinch down smaller loads.  I needed a pack this size that is a bit larger than a day pack.  It will be perfect for an inn to inn hike I'm doing in Solvenia in the fall.  This pack will easily accommodate a 1-2 night hike.  My only nit-pick is why no small zipper pocket on the lid?  I'll be taking this as carry-on, and having an easily accessible but secure pocket on the outside would be nice for passport, wallet, gum, phone, etc.  I didn't even notice it didn't have one when I was looking on-line.  My bad, that's on me, I'll figure something out.
review.name: Comfy, light, and yet beefy

review.reviewBody: I have an older version of  Coulee 40 which I use regularly. It is super durable and I live the tri-zip access...but it is a bit on the bulky/heavy side. I swapped out for the Radix 31 and have used it on several hikes. I've loaded it with around 35lbs for testing and it carries very well. It feels a bit more comfortable than my coulee. The shoulder straps sit better and the pack seems to move with me better. I'm sacrificing a bit on ease of access into the main compartment, and there is no brain, but it's worth it for the weight savings and comfort.
review.name: Light weight, but still carries weight comfotably

review.reviewBody: I got this about a month ago. I have used it on three long day hikes so far. The build quality is up the Mystery Ranch's high standards, materials are holding up great for off trail bushwhacking in the Canadian Rockies. Simply love the Coulee style Yoke setup, super adjustable for the perfect fit.
review.name: Great pack with so much potential

name: Radix 31L Backpack - Men's

review.reviewBody: these Teva Sneakers are soooooo darn comfortable! they support my foot so well and I can even feel I have shoes on! they are like a 2nd skin! so easy to slip on no laces!!!! love these and now I have 2 pairs!!!!!
review.name: love these Teva Sneeks!

review.reviewBody: I wear these shoes all day. Great for comfy feet all the time. I have a wide foot.
review.name: 3rd pair - one in every color

review.reviewBody: As I've gotten older, pressure on the front of my foot has caused consistent numbness. Incredibly, though, a pair of Teva flip-flops I've probably had for a dozen years is the only footwear I have found with which I don't feel the numbness. I was hoping this shoe would be similar, but the padding is just not the same, and it was not comfortable to wear. For someone with young, normal feet, though, I'm sure it would be just fine.
review.name: Handsome, lightweight, impressive shoe, but not right for me

review.reviewBody: Love that the toe box fits my wide feet. I've worn these most every day since I got them and they were comfortable from the start. Love that they're easy to put on. I really wish the insoles had more cushion/support, though. On long days of walking, my feet hurt. Not as great of a travel shoe as I had hoped. Going to buy inserts and see if that helps.
review.name: Great shoe. Just wish there was more cushion.

review.reviewBody: My shoes arrived in a timely manner (as all of my Teva orders do!) and are so very comfortable and fun to wear! When they get wet, they dry quickly too! Keep up the good work Teva, and I will be ordering more soon!!
review.name: Love My New Teva Shoes!!

review.reviewBody: The shoes are very cute but have no arch support and little padding. Walking more than around the hallways in my building would lead to sore feet.
review.name: Cute but...

review.reviewBody: They look like Vans and have no arch support. Haven't decided if I'm keeping them, but I doubt it.
review.name: Vans look alike

review.reviewBody: Love these so much!! I couldn't decide between the light grey and the olive but went with the grey and I love them, the color goes with everything! Lo and behold, olive went on sale two weeks later so I bought those too! Awesome for a quick slip on. Great for dog walks, farmers markets, honestly just about anything! Even cute with a casual dress or skirt! Runs true to size for me!
review.name: Love these!!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable right out of box. Nice sized toe box. Easy to put on. No shie string tying. White sole makes it a good boat shoe.
review.name: I highly recommend this shoe.

review.reviewBody: Comfortable first time wearing. Love the option for heel up or down. Love the material. Foot stays cool
review.name: Comfortable and versatile

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I am 5'10 and based on the size guide I fit a small long. However, the main issue I had was that the torso was too short, even with the straps at maximum length. I do not believe these would fit someone taller than me unless they have a relatively short torso.
The quality seemed great, but these bibs would be better if there was a front zipper or if the straps could be unhooked. At its current design, you have to lift the straps over your head which is almost impossible if you also have on a helmet. 
If the torso length could be adjusted along with the strap issue, this would be a five star product.
review.name: Quality, but Some Design and Sizing Issues

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: The pants have a great color and I like the quality of the fabric (both the pants and the "chest" fabric). They fit big. I'm 5'4, 135lbs and the medium are too big. However, the torso is too short for me (I can't tighten the straps to get a good upper body fit). Giving 4/5 because of the fit. Otherwise great product.
review.name: A little bit big, and torso too short

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fit is just off. Have a medium in every mhw pant but the bib was way tight in the hips and waist. Material was great, but the cut was not on point.
review.name: Close but not there.

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
As a 5’10” 140 lb gal, I was excited to see a women's bib offered in a tall size. I purchased these as my work pants for ski patrol. I am on the mountain and wear these bibs 30-40 hours per week.

Pros: the inseam of the leg is just about perfect, but may be too short for anyone taller. The side zip is convenient for when nature calls!

Cons: the fabric of the bibs is quite delicate. I’m likely using these pants a bit harder than the average skier since they are my work uniform, but in the 3 months I’ve been wearing the bibs, I’ve noticed some wear and tear beyond what I would have generally anticipated. The worst areas of wear are in the pockets and knees. The left pocket has a tether and is where I wear my beacon. The pocket has ripped and started to delaminate. Both pockets have developed small holes— again because I keep equipment in my pockets— but why have pockets if you can’t use them? Disappointed that such an expensive pair of pants probably won’t last me beyond this season. I wish outerwear companies would make durable quality items available in women’s cuts for female snow professionals— there are lots of us! Reinforcing the knees/pockets with cordura would be a nice option. Also, there isn’t much stretch to the bibs and they have a tendency to ride up with movement.
review.name: Close but not quite

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: Not a great range of motion in these ski pants. Im 5'7", and I order a large. It was still tight in the legs when I squatted. Not ideal for skiing
review.name: On the small side

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m 5’5 and 150lbs and prefer a slightly baggier fit, and the large was absolutely perfect. Plenty of room for layering and great pockets all over!
review.name: Great Snowpants

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are very well made and look durable. The long side zipper will allow for bathroom breaks without removing all my top layers which is a must in bibs. I’m 5’6” 120 lbs, pretty narrow/not hippy and these are roomy on me. I have a short torso with longer legs and these could be a hair longer but they are comparable to other bibs I have. With no insulation and roomy legs/waist area, I plan to use these on extra cold days with my Ghost Whisperer down pants underneath. That wasn’t my intention when buying them but after trying on, they’ll work great for this purpose! I have slimmer shell bibs I use in the backcountry.
review.name: Super Durable, Great Features

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m 5’4 145 lbs athletic build. My thigh are large and muscular; hips 39” and waist 29.5.” These do not fit. I can barely squat as the thighs are skin tight, but the bibs look great when I’m standing up and not moving. They are just not functional and if I ever needed to layer for colder weather it wouldn’t be possible. The length is a little long. I tried a large short in another mountain hardware style of bibs and the legs fit great but the waist, stomach, chest was so large it looked ridiculous. Clearly this brand is not made for my body. I will have to search elsewhere. I’m sad because these seem to be made so well and I like the style.
review.name: Very nice quality, strange fit

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These bibs are amazing.  You may think you would lose style/fit/quality with bibs, but you will be very pleasantly surprised and eager to hit the slopes and apres activities in your new bibs.  There is waist/hip cinching system that you will love!  They are extremely comfortable on, will not inhibit any moves and will add value to your day!!  

I'm 5'6", 127 lbs and have them in small / short.  The length is perfect, but if you are over 5'6" and have long legs, go with the regular length.
review.name: Perfect fit, great quality!

review.itemreviewed: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody:
After being pleased with my MH shell, I decided to try these bibs and so glad I did. So far they've been worn skiing and snowmobiling in various conditions, from 28 degrees and snowing 2" an hour, pouring rain, and cold dry single digit weather. The waterproofing is superior, and blocks the wind well enough. 
The fabric is comfortable and doesn't feel constricting. I'm 5'2", about 130 lbs, with pretty beefy legs and butt. The medium short is definitely roomy, which is what I wanted to allow for layering and freedom of movement. I LOVE that there are options for length. This should be standard in the industry!
The leg pockets fit a phone perfectly and have stayed waterproof. The chest pockets are more for sunglasses, chapstick etc, and not a phone, but you shouldn't have your phone right next to your beacon anyways. 
The zipper works well enough for peeing. It's a pretty easy process. 
Overall, this bib is just a great no-nonsense product that does exactly what you need it to do: Keep you dry and comfortable.
review.name: Everything you need and nothing you don't

name: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: Don’t know if I received a defective pair but a hole opened on my right pocket and some tears started showing up in the bottom leg, I used this one time for snowboarding and it ended up like this, outrageous. Luckily I had my extra pair that I bought from Amazon for 20 dollars and they held up better than these, idk if gortex or mountain hardware is going down but it’s crazy how these got past their quality control and how badly these held up compared to a pair an 1/8 of the price pair of snow pants.

review.reviewBody: I’m 6’1” / 170 with 32” waist. These were just the right length with the skirt and pant over the boot even though they seemed a bit shorter than a true 34” inseam which I prefer.  Color was much nicer than I was expecting based on photos on the website. Snowboarded all day in 25degree temps with blowing snow with just a thin base layer and was never once cold.
review.name: Much nicer in person and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great fit, warm and dry. Love the feel of the pants. Not slippery like some ski pants.
review.name: Awesome pants

review.reviewBody: Easy to install.   Bought a few month ago and used it a couple of times.
review.name: Looks nice. Funtions well.

review.reviewBody: i had it now for 12 years and it is the greatest bike rack ive add in my life
review.name: i love it

review.reviewBody: Completed my own Sprinter build and selected the Thule over a competing product   better warranty and I liked the design.  Had to fabricate a mounting system as I have a custom rack that wouldn't work with Thule's mounts (not unexpected   Thule can't anticipate every vehicle).  I don't like the side mount plastic feet clips   they are cheap looking and make the van look cheap   so I created a different solution out of aluminum.  To be honest I can't imagine a high quality product like this providing plastic parts like this but hey   it's a small thing.  The crank arm also sticks / is hard to remove but found a simple solution by watching YouTube (put a rubber grommet on the end)   and it works great.
review.name: For my 2017 Sprinter

review.reviewBody: Had to return. I’m not a heavyset person, couldn’t zip side zipper for torso area. Size medium. Teenager fit.  It’s a shame because I really liked the bibs.
review.name: Size issue

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Since I can't update my older review writing a new one. Used the bibs in rainy day at the slopes. The fabric is spot on waterproof and breathable. Super impressed how well it moves and repels moisture.
review.name: Since I can't update an older review...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not a lot of cons about this bib. I did size down a full size because otherwise it would be like a potato sack on me, but the smaller size, out of the box, was perfect. Great fabric. Feels durable!
review.name: Just great.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the first pair of bibs I've owned, and also the first shell pant I've owned. I've loved them so far and not only have they been surprisingly warm but exceptionally weatherproof. I found the cuffs to be great around my snowboard boots, but slightly too large for a smaller winter boot, used for things like snowshoeing, but they can be tightened up enough using the buttons positioned at the cuff. I found the one strap system of tightening to be effective and comfortable. The leg vents were easy to use and cooled me down suitably on warmer days on the mountain. These pants are packed full of features and feel very robust, looking forward to getting much more use out of them!
review.name: Super well designed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A great shell for alpine skiing. Skied today with medium under layer leggings, temps in the 20s with snow guns and wind blasting, these bibs kept me warm and dry. Today was the first day, these will be great for patrolling, plenty of pockets but not bulky when skiing. Normally I would wear a large but had to get an XL Short as the L Short was too tight across my ribs. The extra half inch of length still works great.
review.name: Great Pair of Bibs

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Solid design, better than previous model years for fit and function. Durability testing will commence soon!
review.name: Solid design

review.reviewBody: collar folds back on one side very uncomfortable and  pockets are backwards
review.name: weird fit

review.reviewBody: I have yet to test this coat out and about as I just received it, but I must say I am impressed with it already. It's got everything I could need and ask for in a coat; all the pockets you can need and functionality. It fits perfectly snug with giving some room for any layers as well and the color is amazing. I've had the same 686 coat for about 10 years until I destroyed it, and I'm excited to venture out with this new one. 686 does not disappoint!
review.name: Insulated with love

review.reviewBody: Great jacket has lots of cool pockets and I am ready to use it for ski season
review.name: Super warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great jacket. Love all the compartments and zippers!! Super warm also!!
review.name: Super Jacket!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't had a chance to try it out in the winter months yet but it was very warm when I tried it on upon delivery. The asymmetrical sides does make it a little awkward when it's not zipped up all the way. Runs a little big but I prefer it so I can layer up underneath. Overall, it's a nice jacket.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] ALMOST PERFECT

Activity: Resort
Size: L
Height: 5.3-5.6
Weight: 140-170 lbs
Fit True to size

I’m 5’3”, 150lbs. I usually choose size L for extra sleeve length and room in the shoulders.
This jacket is lightweight, warm, good-looking, and roomy enough for layers as well as a 1.5L hydration pack. 
Lots of functional pockets, inside and out, with outer zip-pulls large enough to operate wearing mitts or gloves.
Cozy fleece-lined collar and helmet-compatible hood.
Comfortable for skiing in temperatures ranging from +5C to -20C.
Minus one star because the two-way front zipper is no longer a feature on this year’s Hydra.
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] light but warm. Easy to wear and carry in your pocket for snowboarding
review.name: light but warm. Easy to

review.reviewBody: It had been about 10 years since I bought a new ski jacket. I loved my old one, but it started to get holes and was definitely time for an upgrade. I was delighted to find this option on clearance! Super comfortable and roomy, and I love the thumb hole feature in the sleeves. I'm 5'7" and weigh around 132 lbs -- I got a M because I like to have a little bit of room in my jackets and this was perfect. The sleeves are a bit longer than expected, but the coat feels like a good oversized fit, not too big but great for layering inside. I've worn it for 5 days of Spring skiing and am very happy with my purchase. Something to note is the unorthodox style of the zipper -- because it zips up and to the side, the left flap is larger than normal. I was not a fan at first because when I skied with the jacket not fully zipped the large flap was in my line of sight, which was frustrating. But as I've worn it more and figured out how to position it well, it's no longer an issue. Just be aware that it takes a few wears to loosen up the newness of the jacket to get the flap to lay flat when not fully zipped. Nevertheless, I would recommend it!!
review.name: Love my new jacket!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great waterproof jacket. On cold days def need extra layering tho. I love all the extra pockets and Kleenex holder. Fits over helmets. I use this jacket on rainy days too!
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket was so comfortable for spring snowboarding. Loved the vents and convenient pockets. Taller collar was great on the lifts. I bought an XS for a more fitted look but my usual size S was not too big either. Still had plenty of room for layers in the morning. Highly recommend this jacket!
review.name: Perfect spring snow jacket

name: Hydra Insulated Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was surprised to see the model in one of the photos wearing these gloves while walking his dog because that’s basically what I use them for as well. I have one medium and one larger-sized dog and they get walked two times a day on leashes regardless of the weather here in southwest Montana. The leather is very soft, as is the liner. The have been warm and they are my go-to winter gloves for walking the dogs and for daily wear. The only negative (and the only reason for four instead of five stars) is that the leather is somewhat delicate, as should be expected. The friction from holding on to the two leashes has caused some heavy wear to the interior grip portion of the gloves and while they’re still warm, they look like I’ve owned them for at least five years despite this being my first winter with them. I treat all of my possessions with care, but these looked like they’ve been put through the wringer after just a few month of use. If you don’t plan to utilize them for an activity that involves the active use of your hands (gripping something), but rather general every day use, they’ll be great.
review.name: What will you use them for?

review.reviewBody: Great gloves and very warm. Got them on sale so that was a bonus.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a present for my husband, who loves these gloves. He says they're incredibly soft leather, and comfortable and warm. Immediately became his favorite winter work gloves. Worth every penny.
review.name: Wonderful, soft, warm, well made loves

name: Deerskin Primaloft Ribbed Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love Keen shoes. I wish you still had the biking shoes.
review.name: I love Keen shoes. I

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these after trudging through a teary-eyed winter hike in supposedly “waterproof” non-keen hiking boots, and I could not be happier with the difference!
review.name: Finally warm, protected, & truly insulated boots

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wanted to love this boot. Normally wear a size 8 but this was way too big. The height of the ankle was just high enough to dig into my ankle. Saw older models in stores but not on line that had slightly lower ankle height. Had bought them during Black Friday so was exited by the deal but now will need to pay full price if I try the 7. 5. Wish there were more options for Polar Keene boots.
review.name: Wanted to love this boot.

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Best boots I have ever bought. And I have been doing that for over 50 years. Very comfortable wearing thick hiking socks over my compression socks. Exactly what I was hoping for. Kudos to Keen for a great product!
review.name: More comfortable than my bedroom slippers!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been buying Keens and they are usually one size smaller, and I have to order a larger size. I ordered the bigger size for these boots and they came too big. Had to send them back.
review.name: Size too big

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these back in March 2024 at the end of last winter season so I didn't get to use them until this weekend hiking in the Whites Mountains of NH. These shoes kept my feet very temperature regulated, warm while not making my feet sweat. Wide toe box which is ideal, the traction I had with them was awesome, and they seem like they will hold up to the rough terrains I frequently hike. They do go up higher on your calf than my regular Merrells I hike in the summer with, however it wasn't a problem for me/I had no pain hiking. Excited to take these out more this season!
review.name: So far so good!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots (Revel IV) have kept my feet warm and offer sturdy support, good sized toe box, deep treads and I wear them year round. My feet do not get hot in the summer. Most of the trails are very rocky and have tree roots, tree debris on them so they get a work out. I have hiked through small amounts of water and my feet stay dry. This is my 2nd pair and now I wish I ordered a different color but other than that. . . they get mediocre to poor reviews by hiking boot critics but I disagree. They seem sturdier than the Targhee model.
review.name: No breaking in

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Too tight in the toe box. Could be due to the insulation. Not sure If I'm going to keep them. I'll try will thinner socks.
review.name: Tight Toe

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfy, lightweight, roomy, and warm. What more could you ask for.
review.name: Awesome!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: There is adequate width at the toe box which helps with narrow heel and wider forefoot (duck feet). That part is comfortable, The upper boot is stiffer than expected, causing discomfort against the lower tibias. Unclear whether this will flex more with time. I dont want to use them for long hikes or scrambles, they are strictly for snow shoeing
review.name: There is adequate width at

name: Revel IV Mid Polar Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have a Reagan top from a few years ago that I really want to love, but the cut is a little too boxy and not super flattering. I decided to give this one a go, but sized up to a large, and I think it works better for my curves. I do still wish it were slightly less boxy. I also don't think the sleeve cut is super flattering on my upper arms, but I'm willing to look past that because it's a pretty cute top.
review.name: Almost there

review.reviewBody:
I debated on what size to get so I went with the size guide and read every review and the top was too big under the arms and across the chest. It’s a really cute shirt so I was disappointed.
Should have ordered my regular size.
review.name: Too big!

review.reviewBody: I love the details on the collar and around the arms. Fabric is soft and a lovely print, very vintage looking. Fits okay, maybe a tad small for a Carve medium and pooches out at the back. I am short waisted so this is frequently an issue for me with tailored shirts. Length is fine but for someone with a long torso it may be too short.
review.name: Great tailoring details

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I haven't traveled with this top yet, but I will. It is super lightweight and fits perfectly. I love the length, which is neither cropped nor too long. The muted colors are perfect for a 'Summer' undertone.
review.name: Perfectly lightweight for travel

review.reviewBody: Light weight. Not see through. Looks great with jeans for date night or with linen pants brunch.
review.name: Great Top

review.reviewBody: I loved everything about it, except the way it fit on me. The sleeves are boxy. Probably would have been better as a tank top.
review.name: Wanted to love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been looking for a while for blouses I can wear everyday and for work. This is comfortable and really cute.
review.name: Great summer blouse!

review.reviewBody: Very feminine and lightweight. Perfect for summer!
review.name: Love this top!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this, I bought the white top. I did go from small to medium. This is 100% cotton so if you are a size B or more, I would recommend to go up one size for this reason. Easy top to dress up or wear with jeans. Enjoy!
review.name: Summertime Look

review.reviewBody: Super cute, but had to exchange for a bigger size as it was just barely too short in the torso. Normally wear a size L and exchanged for an XL. New top hasn’t shown up so I’m hoping it’s the right size and doesn’t shrink in the wash
review.name: Love the look

review.reviewBody: Perfect Patagonia product: warm and not heavy. I've had Nano puff pullovers and the vest is equally as efficient.  Can wear for any occasion.
review.name: great weight and warmth

review.reviewBody: Great for daily use, light but still warm enough.
review.name: Simple and effective

review.reviewBody: I bought as a gift for my son and he is very pleased with it. He is very tall and the vest is long enough for him. I would have liked it to be packages a little better, it was in a little ball all wrinkled when it came.
review.name: Nice vest

review.reviewBody: Sage Khaki is not the most attractive color, almost like a golden/yellowish green.
review.name: Sage Khaki

review.reviewBody: Love the nano puff.  Have in multiple colors and bought for my kids as well.  Super functional as a layer in cold weather but also versatile and good-looking enough to be warn casually or at work.  Love that it's a "puffy" but not a "marshmallow puffy".  Fits nice and close to the body.  Fits true to size.
review.name: Tried and True

review.reviewBody:
Patagonia's Nano Puff series are pretty ubiquitous in the PNW for a reason. It's a dependable piece of gear for both hitting the trails and wearing in casual settings. I actually wear mine so much I decided I needed a second color to switch it up once in awhile. Lots of warmth for the weight and conveniently stuffs into the pocket when you need to pack it in your bag. Great for layering under a shell, too. I've put some serious miles on my Nano Puffs and they're holding up great.

For sizing, I can be a M or L depending on the jacket/shirt but for Nano Puffs I have always gone with a M.
review.name: It's a classic

review.reviewBody: Fantastic vest! Not bulky but warm.  Only wish it was not so expensive.
review.name: Light weight and warm

review.reviewBody: Quality construction, warm but not too warm, fitted but not too tight. Happy customer!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Very comfy and warm - can?t go wrong with Patagonia. I?ve officially become a puffy vest guy!  Didn?t think I had it in me.
review.name: Sweet!

review.reviewBody:
This is my second Nano Puff Vest.  The first is still serviceable but looking a bit ragged.  It is a go to piece of gear for me.  It wears well, packs and travels well, and keeps me warm.
 
I wear this under a shell in the Spring and Fall, with medium weight coats and even suit jackets during the Winter here in Western PA.  

It fits me well (I'm 165 lb. and 5' 11" towards slim muscular) and looks good.
review.name: Wear It Everywhere When It's Cold

name: Nano Puff Vest - Men's
Patagonia Men’s Nano Puff Vest | GH Review

review.itemreviewed: MTN Checker Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo much.

I might be overwearing it, honestly. But I don't care. With a unique pattern and a soft touch, it's a great piece of clothing.

My only complaint is that it doesn't have inside pockets.
review.name: Huge Fan

review.itemreviewed: MTN Checker Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been living in this super cozy, super warm, super easy jacket. It’s so easy to throw on and off and keeps me super warm during chilly evenings and nights (30’s 40’s & low 50’s) here in Southern California. It’s definitely not slim fitting and that a really GOOD thing - so it’s easy to get on and off quickly without a fuss. Will definitely be getting another one in a different color. Not sure about its durability just yet but for what I paid it’s an awesome value.  And as a bonus my Jack Russell terrier loves cuddling up with me when I’m wearing it!
review.name: Phenomenal Jacket - LOVE It‼️💕

review.itemreviewed: MTN Checker Sherpa Full-Zip Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this in an XL hoping for a nice, roomy fit but the sizing is kind of strange. The arms are incredibly long and the shoulders are extremely wide, but the length is kind of short and the body is relatively slim for the size. I can't say whether it runs large or small because it's sort of both in different places. It's super soft and the colors are great, but the fit is just off.
review.name: super soft but ill-fitting

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable for 50-65 degree ride. Colder than that and I would pair with a windbreaker. Good length with nice deep pockets. I put an entire water bottle in one of the pockets so I could put a Road Boba in my extra holder. No regrets. Would size up though. I'm 5'6", 128 lbs, 32DD, 28" waist. Initially ordered the Small, but it was so tight I could see everything I'd ever eaten in my life. Medium was still fitted, but much more comfortable. Kinda wish it had thumb holes. Love it and will prob get it in other colors.
review.name: Great for those fall transitions

review.reviewBody:
Things we need to own here? is Pearl Izumi Assos? no and they will never be. Will you look as cool wearing this as you will Castelli, probably not. 

But when you?re messing around early season on your gravel bike or out on the road and you go down destroying your gear, trust me? you?re going to be pretty happy you didn?t just shred a $250 long sleeve jersey made by another brand. 

Pearl Izumi is affordable and meets your expectations, how ever low, every time. I have this long sleeve jersey in a few colors and frequently wear them with a long sleeve base and a wind vest and feel pretty comfy in that 60-45° range.

Bust 36c. Height 5?4 Weight 135 Size M
Fit perfect.
review.name: It?s PI. Don?t over think it.

review.reviewBody:
I got the atomic red in my usual size and I love it. It is TTS but form-fitting. I wear it over a light jersey and under a fall jacket in temperatures around 40F. 

The pockets seem sturdy. Haven't actually used them yet. I look forward to wearing this without a shell on cool spring days.

The atomic red is an awesome color. A little neon, almost pink but not quite.

Initially I received the wrong color because of an error on the site, but customer service was great about expediting an exchange.
review.name: awesome

review.reviewBody: The large is way too small uggg very disappointed!!!!
review.name: Pearl izumi attack thermal

name: Attack Thermal Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: Im happy with it , cool design, doesn’t move while running
review.name: Cool design

review.reviewBody: Excellent vest with get organization structure.  Customer service was amazing.
review.name: Great product. Even better customer service

review.reviewBody: This is my first hydration vest. I have to say I love it. I am new to running and had a spibelt previously that bounced too much. This vest does not bounce at all, feels secure and has so many pockets for whatever I may need to carry while on my long runs.
review.name: New runner

review.reviewBody: I needed a vest for shorter runs (< 8 miles) that would still have room for my phone, keys, ID, water and a snack or two if needed. I fell in love with the white and aqua colorway and it looks even better in person! This fits true to size and doesn’t bounce at all.
review.name: Great for shorter runs!

review.reviewBody:
Just tried this product today - it holds all my essentials and the pockets are very accessible. The mesh pockets in the back is a neat feature. However, I find that the vest is still quite bouncy even when I have tighten the strings.

I will update my review after I have used this for my full marathon.
review.name: Works but still bouncy

review.reviewBody: I’m size 8-10 and order small is a great fit with stuff in it not too tight and doesn’t bounce a lot.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I bought a 12L and love it too. Way easier on my back than a back pack.  I only use it for hiking
review.name: Saves lower back pain.

review.reviewBody: Needed something for long runs that was small enough to be comfortable but still hold everything I need and this was perfect!
review.name: Perfect fit!

review.reviewBody: I have a 12 L version of this bag too. It’s awesome way better than wearing a backpack for a long hikes.
review.name: Tight fit but awesome

review.reviewBody:
After quite a bit of research I decided to buy the Salomon ADV SKIN . My other pack, from a well known hydration bidons & bladders/packs, rubbed against my collarbones and left wounds. This pack so far has been a bit more gentle.

My only issue with this pack is thet I wish the front zipped pocket wasn't see through. Don't exactly want to advertise my debit card or other valuables. ;)
review.name: So far so good

name: ADV Skin 5L Set Hydration Vest

review.reviewBody: Second pair of these. I bought in nude color, and I loved them so much I bought them in black for next Summer.
review.name: Georgia girl who loves shoes!

review.reviewBody: TTS, great shoe, Sorel never disappoints! This shoe is comfortable, sturdy and fun.
review.name: Shoes are comfortable and platform soles allow for longer pants ( no need to hem). Main reason for purchase. Can be dressed up with nice pants or dressed down with casual look.

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately for me, the strap on the back does not have any adjustments and since I bought the shoe online, I did not notice this (it's not something I would think to check on a Sorel sandal). And if you hold it up from the side, the strap extends past the heel. There's no way it will hold the shoe on. Bummer because they are super cute, but I can't wear them.
review.name: Beware: Strap does not adjust!
comment: Hello kkb123, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry DAYSPRING™ Slingback Fisherman Women's Platform Sandal didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: Love love love! So many compliments too. Heel strap is a little loose and no way to tighten, but it's workable and the shoes are very cute and so comfy.
review.name: Love love love

review.reviewBody: Cute shoes. Large volume so did not fit close enough to my foot and non adjustable.
review.name: Cute but not a good fit
comment: Hello Eadie, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our DAYSPRING™ Slingback Fisherman Women's Platform Sandal is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Amazing comfort fit & style. Great quality and super versatile: went down half a size for best fit.
review.name: Best in Show award!

review.reviewBody: I bought these sandals in both the beige and black colors.  The shoe is so stylish and comfortable.    However, even going down 1/2 a size, my foot did not feel stable.   It felt like I could easily roll my ankle.
review.name: Stylish, but unstable
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: love these!  Super cute but the strap is a little scratchy.  They are very comfortable, super cute, except for one thing.  The right side back strap has a scratchy velcro seam that hits right in the wrong place.  This might not be an issue for everyone, and I'll figure out a work around, but that is the only reason I gave them a 4, they are a 5 on every other level:)  I did size down from my regular 8.5 re: other reports and the 8 fits perfectly.
review.name: Love these!  Super cute but the strap is a little scratchy.......

review.reviewBody: These run 1/2 size larger than normal. I wear a 9 and had to order a 8 1/2 and they fit perfect. Very cute, chunky and comfortable.
review.name: Super cute & comfortable sandal

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the trending fisherman style with a platform... will be a summer staple! I had to size down a half size with this sandal unlike other Sorel sandals in the past.  Runs large!
review.name: On trend fisherman platform sandal!

name: Dayspring Slingback Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I gave this backpack to my husband for his birthday.
He appreciated it so much.
Very comfortable, roomy and practical.
He use it every day.
review.name: Birthday gift

review.reviewBody:
Have had many backpacks, but this may be the “keeper of all keepers”. Good size for daily use, stylish to wear when out and about, yet hardy enough to take on camping and outdoor excursions. Definitely appreciate the simplicity of the two pockets and laptop
Sleeve. Would absolutely recommend this to a friend!
review.name: Fantastic bag!

review.reviewBody:
I really love this little backpack. I should note that I bought it to haul my laptop and other work items back and forth
to the office so I cannot testify to how it holds up in the wild. The size is perfect for a day hike or hunt, but not for anything overnight. There is no place to store a water bottle. The bag is well-built, color and design are great and I love hiking into the office with it.
review.name: Love this bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for the Toubkal summit and it did not disappoint. Full disclosure, it wasn't packed for a thru hike so I still need to see how it will pack using a sleeping pad in place of the frame, but it was ridiculously light so I am hopeful when I pack it for extended hiking it will be comfortable. I was able to adjust it easily to my size and it had ample exterior zipped pockets for water and other small items. I even used a 1.5 liter bladder internally and it worked fine. Using the bladder actually helped with weight distribution.
review.name: Ultralight and Ultra-amazing!
