review.reviewBody: Fits true to size. Great heel and toe control. No dead spots that I experienced in the Evolve Agro.
review.name: Shaman Lace

review.reviewBody: Great sensitivity and performance on overhanging routes. Comfortable as well.
Great shoe, heels don’t pop for me on this

These are the only aggressive shoes I could find in my size and they do not disappoint. They have an aggressive toe turn that is perfect for standing on those tiny foot holds on a climb. 
The only issue I had with them was that they get hot quick, climbing in Red Rock in Nevada it gets very hot and these shoes don’t have the same breathability that some other shoes have. However that does not take away from the positive overall experience with these shoes! Would recommend if you are like me and need size 15 aggressive climbing shoes!

Absolutely love this shoe. I've been partial to Solutions and Instincts in the past, and this was my first Evolv shoe. After a bit of a painful break-in period, they have been fantastic. I've used them on outdoor and indoor bouldering and sport, and had the best few months of climbing ever. Precise toes, great edges, solid toe hooks, and the best heel hooks of any shoe I've worn. The rubber is still doing well too. I love the extra control the laces give, and the style, though it's not always as convenient as a strap.
review.name: My new favorite shoe

review.reviewBody: Man I love these shoes. They’re bomber. Good for edging, smearing, sport, and bouldering. The shoes are fairly stiff, but even so I found they work wonderfully on slab. They’re fairly downturned as well, which had me skeptical of their effectiveness on vertical and less than vertical terrain, but my doubts were quickly dismissed. I use these for climbing on a lot of dacite, which climbs pretty similarly to granite. They work great on limestone sport climbs as well. A wonderful stiff, but not too stiff, bouldering and sport climbing shoe. I got exactly my street shoe size, maybe a half size up (I wear a 10 in vans and A 41.5 in solutions) and I got a size 10 shoe. Hurt a bit but broke in perfectly. Thanks evolv!
review.name: Best of most worlds

review.reviewBody: I love the Shaman Lace for climbing hard on limestone routes. You can edge very precisely. The shoes is very stiff which allows one to put more pressure on your toe point. I order them not too small (same than street shoe), which gives more confort and allow the shoe to break in better on my opinion. Best use for limestone routes, overhangs as well as more vertical climbs.
review.name: Favorite shoe for hard route climbs!

review.reviewBody: Bought this as a outdoor shoe as I live in the northeast and all we have a tiny edges basically. Out of the box super comfortable, the knuckle box and love bump both work as advertised. Toe is the best I’ve used hands down, love the power you can get. The front end fits my foot great, all my toes are curled up without stacking on top of eachother, but the shoe still feels very tight. The only complain I have is the heel fit, I have a very narrow heel and struggled to find shoes that fit that, evolv seems to fit the width very well, but the overall shape just doesn’t seem to work great with my heel. It hasn’t been a huge issue when hooking, but my heel doesn’t really sit in the bottom of the shoe, which ends up affecting how much I can feel below it. Never pops out, no slippage really, just some air under my heel. With that being said, I wanted a shoe for outdoor bouldering with tiny edges, and this is absolutely perfect for that. 4.5 stars would be more appropriate for my review.
review.name: Great shoe, powerful and sticky. Weird heel fit

review.reviewBody: I bought the Shaman lace for use on the crag I was skeptical about the fit to take having a pair of phantoms in size 7.5 even if they fit the size of my road shoe they are much smaller but due to the neoprene thing that expands over the fingers this was not a problem. Instead for the Shaman I chose half a size more than the phanton and I must say that I immediately had an excellent sensation of precise wrapping all around the foot and the arched toes but not too much so as not to be able to keep them in the feet, it has become my Favorite shoe, I recommend it to everyone, even my son who is in the pro Evolv program is super happy to compete with shaman pro and zenith, what else to say Thank you Evolv
review.name: Thank you evolv

review.reviewBody:
EL PRODUCTO ES PERFECTO TIENE UNA ADAPTACION MUY BUENA (A LO QUE SE REFIERE A MI PIE)
TIENE UN BUEN CANTEO EN REGLETAS Y SIENDO UN PIE DE GATO BASTANTE DURO EN PLACA DE GRANITO ME DA MUCHA SEGURIDAD.
SOLO DOS COSAS QUE CREO QUE PODRIAN MEJORAR
1- EL CORDAGE PARA MI LE FALTA SIMPLEMENTE EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR OTROS ORIFICIOS PARA PODER CERRAR UN POCO MAS.
2- LA UNION DE LA PUNTERA CON LA SUELA NO SE EL MOTIVO PERO RAPIDAMENTE SE DESPEGA.
POR LO DEMAS EL SHAMAN LACE ES PERFECTO
review.name: MI SENSACION

name: Shaman Lace Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought these hoping they would be as comfortable ad the prana koen capri. They are comfy, but they are small in the waist.
review.name: Comfy, but small in the waist

review.reviewBody: Nice fit and color. I’m 5’6” and weigh 130, the size 8 fit well. I love all the pockets.
review.name: Lots of pockets

review.reviewBody: I bought two pairs. Liked them so much I bought two more pairs. The lightweight fabric is cool in humid weather. The cut is slimming but roomy enough that I can workout in them. Love all the pockets. I wash and then hang them to dry. Pants are holding up very well. These OR capris are my go to summer pants!
review.name: Versatile, Cool and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: These are the 2nd pair of women's Ferrosi Capris that I've purchased and absolutely love them! Perfect fit, perfect length, super comfortable, launder beautifully, and last! I think Outdoor Research is a quality brand at a reasonable price!
review.name: Perfect Capris!!

review.reviewBody: Can't decide if I should return. Originally ordered size 8, returned for size 10. These seem to run small in waist/rear. 5'1", 123 mature lbs. Some reviews state that these stretch. Not sure how these will wear on me. Guess I'll keep because they aren't tight, just snug. Hoping they will stretch out. We'll see. If not...at least I know the sizing is off for me and won't order again.
review.name: Nice Feel, Light & Airy...but...seem to run small

review.reviewBody: Lives up to ferrosi name. Stretchy, nice fitting. Love colour goes with most things.
review.name: Super comfy stylish great for hiking

review.reviewBody: I have a pair of Ferrosi shorts I love that are 6 years old.  So I bought the capris in the same size. They were way too small in the width!  I had to buy the next size up. One size bigger fit perfect.  I love the fabric, I swim in lakes and kayak with these they are light, stretchy and quick drying.  The front pockets are great but the back pockets are a waste of time and fabric.  I’d rather have another zipped pocket up front or on the side.
review.name: Love the front pockets!

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable material for me.  It’s light and breathable with this fluctuating Spring weather yet it’s cool for 80 degree days and cooler night temps in mid 50s.  It has belt loops and draw string.  I like that I can use a belt. I’m petite at 5’1” with round tummy and no but.  It’s not tight at the knee so it’s not a problem for me to roll them up when I get acupuncture.
review.name: Love, Love, Love them!

review.reviewBody: I am a curvy size 6. I was worried about the waist being tight as per other reviews. It's not. Follow the size guide and they'll fit. They fit wonderfully, I'm super happy with them. They're higher in the back so no crack-show when I'm squatting down or anything. Great material, lots of stretch, perfect waist. No negatives.
review.name: These are great.

name: Ferrosi Capri Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I purchased this Dakine Method DLX 28L Backpack in Poppy Griffen for an upcoming Three week stay in Montana.  It did not disappoint!  I have never used a Backpack as a 'personal item', normally using a crossbody for flights, combined with a carry on. There are so many things about this pack to love! The shoulder straps are super comfortable and the sternum strap was put to good use, returning home with 19lbs of Montana treasures. And yes, I weighed it!  My first flight, it fit perfectly under the seat. Second connection, it was a bit snug so I decided to put up in overhead. I love the double water bottle pockets, which are deep and secure. The front accessory zip pockets are one of the main reasons for my purchase.  I didn't want to have to dig into a pack for my phone and wallet. I actually used the wide one for a small paperback. The quality is top notch, smooth zippers and very good stitching. I used the top loop many times and it always felt secure. The material seems super durable and The Poppy Griffen pattern is lovely. I am very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Perfect travel backpack!

name: Method DLX 28L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought these about a month ago and have worn them a handful of times. They are very warm and comfortable! Fit great, though I wish they were longer. Too short to roll up, and they are on the verge of high waters.
review.name: so comfy and warm!

review.reviewBody: Soft comfort and durable
review.name: Great pants for the buck

review.reviewBody: I was super skeptical of the fitting, but these were great for me.  I'm built like a troll- 5'8, 220 pounds, 25” quads and 18.5” calves.  Needless to say, buying pants on line is almost impossible.  These fit me perfectly, no issue with them being too baggy or too tight.  If you’ve got big booty like me, you’ll also be A-OK.  I wore them out on a December Portland, Maine trip where we took a day on the Atlantic in a small boat to see some of the islands, they were perfect.  Both comfy and stylish for around town, but also with some added warmth.
review.name: Great Pants!

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband and they’ve quickly become the only pants he chooses to wear. Please bring them back in more colors!
review.name: My husband’s new favorite pants

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these boots.  First pair lasted about 10 years.  My new pair fit perfectly and broke in immediately.  Very comfortable and great ankle support with binding or being restrictive.
review.name: Great Boots - Fit, Comfort, Longevity

review.reviewBody: I returned these boots because the 6 was too large and 5.5 not available. Disappointed ☹️
review.name: Great heavy boot

review.reviewBody: The boot is a great quality boot. The fit is good however on steep technical hills my heel slips a tad and has completely made my heel so raw that I cannot put a shoe on. I have broken them in and attempted 3 separate hikes all to no avail of a happy heel at the end. Down hill, the toe stays put and feels great, I just cant seem to go uphill comfortably. We have all types of terrain S. New Mexico and the sole is great for cactus, slipper rock, and hot surface. I wanted to like them much more than I do. Size 6 is what the chart recommends but it just doesn't work. Even doubling socks.
review.name: Heel is raw

review.reviewBody:
After a ton or research I settled on these hiking boots.  I have a normal forefoot and very narrow heels and experience slippage in many shoes.  First, they run quite large.  All my athletic footwear is a size 8.  I'm a 7 in Asolo.
With major modifications I minimized slippage:   TWO surgeon knots for lacing, Superfeet insoles for hiking boots added and thick socks.

They still slipped a bit and I would have to retie frequently.   Feet were also quite hot as they are not breathable or particularly flexible.

Traction on Arizona dusty, fairly smooth, rocky terrain was acceptable.
Would not repurchase.
review.name: Heavy, not for narrow heels.

review.reviewBody: Asolo, you've done it again.  Last pair I had was the all leather version.  Loved those to pieces and had to buy a new pair.  These are amazing right out of the box.  Perfect fit, no weird hot spots or rubbing.  The tapered sides of the tongue are the best.  Makes for less bunching at the top.  I did an 8 mile hike right away.  Best boots by a mile.
review.name: Best boots

review.reviewBody: Yup - I did it. My first big hike/trek, and after a ton of research - I bought these. They were fantastic - prevented small rocks from getting in, kept my feet warm, didn't make my feet sore or get blisters, and got me to THE TOP! I broke them in on a few hikes, of course. And after, I wore them on multiple safaris and also a full month living in the bush in Botswana - on a Trails Guide course. Very happy I got these!
review.name: Climbed Kilimanjaro in these!

review.reviewBody: I have used these several times this summer. They have great tread for steep hard packed dirt and also scree. Nice ankle support and water resistant in rain or soggy soil. I imagine from the support they would be good for backpacking. Nice and wide in the forefoot for comfort and fit.
review.name: Awesome Hiking Boots

name: Stynger GORE-TEX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable. Keeps me dry on a rainy day.Absolutely would recommend this!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is exactly what I want for an upcoming spring trip overseas. It’ll be easy to pack and perfect weight and wind and water protection. Love the lilac color. Fits true to size.
review.name: Just what I was looking w

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket fit perfectly and very good quality. Lightweight but enough structure to feel strong.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight and good fit to my body, arm lenght is a little bit long for me since am 4'11" and short, But was able to fold and looks nice on me. It would be great, if I could fold it into a pouch for travel, other than that, it's perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter had this same jacket before and outgrew it. She asked to replace it with exact same one. That says it all!!!
review.name: Black rain jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is the most awesome jacket I've ever purchased! The quality is amazing and it fits great and true to size. I have received so many compliments on it!
review.name: Very Stylish!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well; I choose one size up from recommended to allow for a layer underneath when cooler.  I do wish it was a bit longer (I'm 5'9", and choose the L)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like how it’s longer and stylish. Fits well. Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a well fitting rain jacket. It is very fashionable. Plan to wear on my daily walks when it is raining.
review.name: Smart looking rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Its thin and comfy to wear. The sleeves are long for me but it's ok since I got a size bigger.
review.name: Nice jacket!

description: Buy the Fjallraven Gear Bag 2L Organizer online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Gear Bag 2L Organizer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Gear Bag 2L Organizer online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great for everything. 
Into the our  -Gear bag-  we keep the hiking items.
Lovely.
review.name: Great!!

review.reviewBody: It's amazing how much stuff you can throw into these gear bags. I use them on a daily basis and when out on the trail.
review.name: Looks small. Packs a lot.

review.reviewBody: I have always loved pouches and tiny bags.  I am using this to hold all the small odd things that I lose in my bag or things that jingle annoyingly.  So far I have managed to fit: a pen and notebook,  mirror, tin of mints, a comb, hand sanitizer, 100ml bottle of hand cream, and a small pouch with medications.  There is still a bit of room and I have yet to use the zippered pocket inside.  Before I ordered this I got out a measuring tape so I would know what to expect and not be disappointed if it wasn’t what I had pictured in my mind.
review.name: Just like the Tardis, it’s bigger on the inside

review.reviewBody: This case is amazing for airplane toiletries - it looks compact, but fits more than cases from other brands!
review.name: Bigger Inside

review.reviewBody: This is a bag for storing small gear haha... Wish it were just a little bit bigger. But the little pockets inside are awesome and it's definitely durable!
review.name: Kind of small

review.reviewBody: This bag is so small, you wont fit any "gear" in here and for the price I expected something more than this. Very disappointed.
review.name: Dont buy

review.reviewBody: On a trip through Sweden several women in my traveling group discovered Fjall Raven and have been very satisfied with their purchases. For valentines day I picked up a variety of accessories including a couple of gear bags from the web site that were very well received.
review.name: Gear Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this to put all my watercolor stuff on the go. And it is perfect. It fits all my water brushes, watercolor pallets, small water bottles, small sketchbook, and pens and pencils. I am going to get another. Best gear bag ever!
review.name: Best Gear Bag Ever

review.reviewBody: Very good! My only complaint is that it is a little tight on length for toothbrushes and could be a wee bit wider.
review.name: Good quality!

review.reviewBody: The bag is well-made and functions perfectly. It is a convenient size and has internal pockets for organization. I like that I can also wax the outside of it.
review.name: Great Product

name: Gear Bag 2L Organizer

review.reviewBody:
I have worn this jacket a few times and so far it has driven to wear well in 20-30 degree weather while wearing just a base layer.
Time will tell how the down retains itself and if it will stay warm with hopefully no cold spots.
review.name: Very nice jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this last summer and it's an OK jacket. for the price range, it's relatively heavy however this makes it more durable. With only a baselayer or thin sweater I can take it out to zero celsius. The DWR coating is basically nothing and the down will migrate away from you inner elbows, which leaves that area without insulation.
review.name: OK

review.reviewBody: First, the amount of down in this jacket is pathetic. I know it's supposed to be good down, but the cells were not filled. I can't imagine this jacket wouldn't be filled with cold spots. Second, the fit is very strange. I can't say the the fit isn't true to size - it's a small. The arms don't seem right, however. The hips flare. It's just a strange jacket.
review.name: Not what I expect for the money

review.reviewBody: I bought this in yellow and the color is great--also really warm.   But there was a pin hole in the right shoulder and down started coming out on my first walk... too bad; poor quality.
review.name: hole in shoulder....
comment: Lifetime warranty so get it fixed.

name: Expedition Pack Down Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The large I receive was too small for me. I could only get it halfway up my leg before it became obvious it wasn’t going to fit. Other than that, It's still a good quality bib. 
I ride a Endura Pro SL Bibshort in warm weather, and it doesn’t let me down. Funny, the Pro SL I have now is marked Large and fits fine, so go figure. 
My Pro SL has quite a few miles on it and with the Christmas sales thought it was time to get a new one for the spring rides to come.
review.name: Endura Pro SL EGM Bibshort

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this bib. Fit is true to size chart. They are not only great for all rides but excel in the most comfortable pad for distance/long rides
review.name: Great all around Bib

hasVariant.name: Dulcie Top - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the UGG Dulcie Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Honestly, I was worried that these would be awkward due to the thick platform, but I am pleasantly surprised. They are so cute and can be styled up or down. Plus. These do not get dirty easy! I love my new slippers
review.name: Comfortable and Stylish

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and cute, I wore it with my tights and long flannel jacket.
review.name: So cute

review.reviewBody: This item is was super nice. I wear a medium but a large might've been better.
review.name: It's nice but

review.reviewBody: I bought the Dulcie top in Twister and was able to get the Noreen short in same color. I was thinking mostly for bedtime but both were so soft and comfortable I am wearing them all the time. I was a little worried they may be heavy because of the material but no way, they weren't just soft but so light. They fit true to size altho I got a larger size in the short for room ( I could have gotten the large and the fit would have been good) but with the drawstrings - no worries.
review.name: The softest most comfortable

review.reviewBody: I purchased this top to match the Terri Pant and I'm glad I did. The set together is very nice and flattering. I went for the XL because I am curvy and did not want my stomach showing and it was a great choice. Long enough for not to look like a crop top it hit a at the waist. It's a boucle type fabric but light weight to wear in the summer. Depending on the accessories you can wear this out to run errands or date night.
review.name: Not Just for Indoors

review.reviewBody: The tank is exactly what I've been looking for the right length not to overlap the pants and make it look bulky and the material is well made as well as soft and fuzzy it fits perfect it's beyond comfortable so when I find something I love , I purchase any color it comes in and I'm loving all three colors and their matching flare pant's and next I'm going to purchase the Joggers to match as well and some more tanks ....
review.name: Buying more love them!

review.reviewBody: It was nice and soft, I would have brought it small size
review.name: I would like it to be shorter

review.reviewBody: Giving this to teenager for christmas present. She will probably lounge in it and sleep in it.
review.name: Nice fabric and well made Ugg product

name: Dulcie Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Castelli makes good stuff!  These knee warmers are perfect!
review.name: Perfect knee warmers

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Nano Flex knee and arm warmers. They work great down to about 50F as they have a fleece interior and water beading exterior layer. They aren't water proof but they do repel water for a short while. They are warm as well, perfect for a cool day but not cold enough for full on winter gear. However, like the other review states, these last about a season or two at most, the fleece lining begins to fall apart over time, and not just due to use, it just falls apart. Not immediately but maybe after a year of use.
review.name: Excellent, probably one of the best

review.reviewBody: These are warm and offer good coverage, but the nanoflex coating wore off after a year of light use. This results in an entire external layer of urethane-like particles coming off in a sheet -- it looks awful, the particles get everywhere, and the water resistance is shot. Same thing happened to my nanoflex knickers, though it took longer.
review.name: disintegration

review.reviewBody: These are warm and offer good coverage, but the nanoflex coating wore off after a year of light use. This results in an entire external layer of urethan-like particles coming off -- it looks awful, and the water resistance is shot. Same thing happened to my nanoflex knickers, though it took longer.
review.name: disintegration

review.reviewBody: Great quality, can’t wait to wear it at the highest summit!!
review.name: Parka review

review.reviewBody: Awesome jacket so far. This is my go to when temps drown sun Zero in Alaska.  No complaints!
review.name: Life below zero

review.reviewBody: Very warm parka. Packs down great. The fit comes lower than most which provides extra warmth around your hips. Great for mountaineering expeditions and winter climbing. It fits well over a helmet and other layers under.
review.name: Best Parka!

review.reviewBody: It's the most thoughtfully designed belay parka out there, by far. Excellent features, top-notch materials, and perfect sizing for layering. The photos and videos online don't do it justice, the jacket is way puffier than it looks. The Track My Down touch is also superb.
review.name: "The Puffiest Of Puffies"

review.reviewBody: Used for unseasonably cold June trip up Rainier. Incredibly warm for such a light, packable jacket. Wind chill temps dropped to -25F and felt totally warm at camp / during breaks popping on this bad boy. Also used as additional insulation draping over sleeping bag which really made a difference. Especially like the oversized pockets (super warm), broad sleeves, and large hood for use over helmet. All around perfect mountaineering insulated jacket. Found XL to be on the larger side but kinda love it.. still easily fits under hard shell (6’4 210lbs). I will be taking on any future trips with low temps under 20F.
review.name: Perfect mountaineering jacket

review.reviewBody: My very first parka and I’m already in love with it. The fabric at first looks delicate but it’s quite durable. The size runs big so order carefully. The design of the sleeves is so broad that you can put this jacket on even with your thickest gloves, the hood also accommodates the helmet well. Very satisfied with the warmth this provides on those long cold belays.
review.name: Goodbye cold belays!

name: Phantom Belay Down Parka - Men's

description: Buy the MSR TrailShot Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: TrailShot Microfilter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR TrailShot Microfilter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used many filters and this one is now my favorite. Although I wish it had just a little longer hose. That is the only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars.
review.name: My new favorite filter

review.reviewBody: Used this on multiple bikepacking trips with questionable and/or limited water on some occasions. It's lightweight and never let me down yet.
review.name: Faultless

review.reviewBody: I used this filter for 4 months and it was not very effective. When I wanted to clean it and dry it in the sun, the filter changed shape and it was impossible to put it back together. For a product at this price, it is unacceptable not to be able to wash it. How can I get a refund?
review.name: Bad quality, don't buy!

review.reviewBody: I have 3 different water filters that I use in different circumstances. The trail shot is the only filter I have found that effectively pumps water out of puddles. I use it for mountain and desert trail runs where I don’t expect to find flowing streams or pools deep enough to fill the bottles I use for my katadyn befree system. The trail shot is slow and requires a little patience. That said it is still considerably faster than hunting for bigger pools or digging. This filter has saved my bacon multiple times. I much prefer the Katadyn befree system for runs where I have flowing streams ponds and mountain lakes for speed and simplicity.
review.name: This filter has a specific purpose

review.reviewBody: I brought this and have tested it multiple times and it doesn’t work the filter pops up every time and water leaks out the sides not filtering the water or coming out at the proper place. Is this broken or am I using it wrong?
review.name: Not working

review.reviewBody:
Great filter when first purchased. 

Followed manufacturers instructions for handling, cleaning and storage. Despite this, the filter no longer worked after long term storage. It had only been used for two trips of approx 4 days each in length to filter water for one person.
review.name: Great when it worked, those couple times..

review.reviewBody: After three days on the Long Trail, my brand new Trail Shot stopped sucking. I tried to bring it back, but it was not happening. I had drops for backup. At the first trail town, I found a supplier. They agreed it was broken, and the (very) limited lifetime warranty consisted of paying retail for another filter. I won't be back.
review.name: It didn't suck (and that was the problem)

review.reviewBody: After two weeks of use my msr trailshot broke and no longer filters :(
review.name: Broke down after two weeks

review.reviewBody: I purchased this as a primary water filtering unit while on the go and at first it worked pretty good, it was slow to pump the water but the unit is so small what more could I hope for. I kept up on the cleaning and maintenance as directed and always took very good care of the unit. One day on a four day backpacking trip I was trying to pump water out of a stream and it just would not work, after inspection it seems the seals common to the body just gave up and air is able is getting pumped in and out instead of water. Very disappointed considering I only used it a handful of times.
review.name: Just stopped working

review.reviewBody: First time i'm writing a review And the filter work great over my weekend Hike it when I got back read the instructions and it said to sterilize it For long term use I have said to you six times A iodine tabs and leave it for a half hour which I did And now the bold has a severe discoloration to it
review.name: Bolb discoloration

name: TrailShot Microfilter

review.reviewBody: Use it to haul snowboards, skis, fishing rods, and lacrosse sticks. Super sturdy and durable. Locks keep everything safe & secure. Great investment!!
review.name: Snowpack is great!!

review.reviewBody: … and not just 21 sets of confusing pictures that may or may not be applicable to you. Infuriating. If it weren’t for YouTube or I would have returned these within 30 minutes.
review.name: Instructions require WORDS
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule SnowPack user manual. I understand that the image-based mounting instructions can be somewhat confusing. Thule uses this method to reduce complications in translating user manuals to the more than a dozen different languages spoken in countries where Thule products are sold. This also cuts down on print waste generated by the larger hard-copy manuals more text would create. 
In addition to the print user manual, Thule also has a video demonstration of the installation process in the "Instructions" section of the Thule SnowPack product page, which is also viewable on YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ryF_XRIR_XI&t=39s

review.reviewBody: Thule rack is amazing and I must say customer support is the best ever…
review.name: Amazing rack system

review.reviewBody: I bought this rack a month back and have already used a few times including a road trip. The noise is minimal and it made loading and unloading skis a breeze. Great buy
review.name: Easy, quite and looks great

review.reviewBody: I am a long time Thule product user. Purchased a rack system and the SnowPack M (4 ski) rack. Rack installation was easy after spending a little time to understand the visual instructions. Quality materials, great details and easy to use.
review.name: Quality Ski Rack system,

review.reviewBody: It came with all the parts for multiple bar mounts and big cool surprise, a full set of locks!! That was not described in the product details, so an added bonus. I had it assembled and installed in about an hour. Looks good, closes tight. I would not call it aerodynamic and there is a bit of wind whistle at lower speeds but it meets or exceeds all on my expectations.
review.name: Great ski rack

review.reviewBody: Solid ski rack, if you are looking for a smaller one. Installed in about 10 minutes and I'm not that handy.
review.name: Easy install and easy to use

review.reviewBody: Ordered the evo wing bar kit and ski mount. Used this weekend and everything fit and worked great. Fedex lost some parts but Thule expedited new ones right away, thank you.
review.name: EVO wing bar

review.reviewBody: Easy to install. Sleek design. Easy to use. Love my Thule Snowpack
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: Once you get your head around the diagrams in the instructions, installation is fairly easy. The carrier holds nicely to the cross bars and easily keeps four pairs of x-country skis firmly in place.   I just need more snow now!
review.name: All I need now is more snow

name: SnowPack M Roof Mount

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this sleeping mat! I have a herniated disk in my back but don’t want to be limited on my ability to do backcountry hunts. I’ve been testing this pad out and it’s working great and keeping me free to spend nights in the wilds. Thank you for making lightweight gear that WORKS!
review.name: Love this sleeping mat!

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very comphy, fast to set up and take down. Kept me warm (nights went down to 2 degrees celcius). Good for side sleeping, no pressure points. 4 stars because it makes a lot of noise if you toss and turn.
review.name: comphy but loud

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The mattress is really comfortable and allows you to sleep on your side without touching the ground. Easy to inflate and fold.
review.name: as comfortable as expected

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pad! The R value kept me toasty warm, and my tent mate said it was very quiet....Genius incorporating the inflating pump into the bag -- I'll never lose it. What I MIGHT lose, however, is the patch repair kit -- perhaps consider having a small envelope in the stuff sac to store the repair kit? Otherwise, love this pad -- it was very comfy for me as a side sleeper. Great product!
review.name: Etherlight Sleeping pad

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm only starting out in ultralight backpacking, and did tons of research before purchasing the Ether Light XT. It did not disappoint. It much more comfortable than any sleeping pad I've tried, compresses to a small, compact size, and I flates effortlessly with the built in inflation bag
review.name: Great, ultralight air mattress!

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have this sleeping pad. It is the best I’ve ever slept on and I’ve been backpacking a long time. Very comfortable and wake up without a back ache. It’s worth the extra weight. I like it so much I’ve bought same for my son and grandson.
review.name: I have this sleeping pad.

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pad and worked well. The fill pump bag was easy to use. Got great sleep 8 nights deep in the back country
review.name: Great system easy to use

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had a minuscule hole in my mat that I couldn’t find. I had tried submerging the mat, spraying every inch with water, etc. to no avail. I reached out to Sea to Summit and explained this and they released my mat without any issues. I can’t say enough about this upstanding company.
review.name: Two thumbs up

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The lightest and most comfortable sleeping pad on the market. We bought one for each of our family members before the canoeing the boundary waters.
review.name: Great Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Ether Light XT Insulated Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this product never had a 25 inch wide pad. I will never go back worth the weight.
review.name: Love

hasVariant.name: Descendant 6K Eagle DUB Crankset
hasVariant.description: Buy the TruVativ Descendant 6K Eagle DUB Crankset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I am not a carbon crank guy, this crank comes stock on many Sram builds. Its really heavy at 700g. Its very stiff, as it should be at that weight. The cranks are one of the places where you only notice the weight on the scale. I am not a believer in Carbon cranks. on anything but the lightest duty bikes and riders you see way too many failures. Having the pedal spindle pull out of your carbon crank upon landing isnt good.It also happens all the time.  
These came stock on my bike and I am pleased enough. I will probably move them to a new frame when I move on. 
3 stars is because they use an Aluminum alloy bolt in the spindle clamp and this part should be steel for longevity.  If this alloy bolt cross threads into the steel spindle , it will turn the cranks into a paper weight. At this price point make it a steel to steel clamping surface. 
Otherwise these cranks are solid and better durability and stiffness than other budget cranks like NX and SX.
review.name: comes stock for a reason

name: Descendant 6K Eagle DUB Crankset

review.reviewBody: Very well thought out pockets and storage. Well made.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: I like everything about it, except that it sits on my right shoulder while casting. Simms please make a mirror image of this pack that does all the same functions but sits on the Left shoulder and spins around to access the opposite direction.
review.name: For lefties

review.reviewBody: It sits awkward on the shoulder.  I’ve loosened the straps tighten them.  Adjusted it as many different ways as I could and nothing.  I would love to switch it for something else.
review.name: Looks good, doesn’t fit good.

review.reviewBody: I have it all loaded up ready to go, just waiting on the weather to warm up. So far it has a lot of space for everything with room to spare. The built in net holder is really slick.
The pack is very light. It holds everything I need. I really like how it holds the net.
review.name: Great sling pack

review.reviewBody: Nice design but I can't get it to hang right on me and feel comfy. Maybe I'm too used to chest packs. I ended up using it on my personal pontoon boat as a boat bag that I can quickly take with me when wading. Doesn't work with a life vest on, unlike chest packs.
review.name: Well made sling pack.

review.reviewBody: Lots of storage and can easily carry it around all day. Switch the pack over to an early ice fishing pack for walking out on the lakes in the early season.
review.name: Multiple uses

review.reviewBody: Bag is awesome. Shipping department needs some attention. Took almost a month to get!
Nice, comfortable sling pack. Roomie enough for all my essential gear and a few extras. A big improvement over my Tributary sling.
review.name: Just the right size

review.reviewBody: While it looks like a great design, I find it very uncomfortable for wading and continually turning it to access the pockets. I am opting for another model that can be worn on a belt.
review.name: Uncorfortable for me

name: Freestone Sling Pack

description: Buy the Optimus Terra Xpress HE Cook Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Terra Xpress HE Cook Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Optimus Terra Xpress HE Cook Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have used this pot a few times now and it has performed exactly as it was intended.  I cooked some beef stew in it on one occasion and have used it a few times to boil water.  It's nice and light, and I haven't had any issues with cleaning it or making room for it in my pack.  My only wish is that it would be nice if the handles were about a half inch longer, but I feel like that might be nit picking a bit.  It's a nice little pot that I hardly notice in my pack.
review.name: Nice little pot

review.reviewBody: With a family of five this was a must have to cook with the Elektra cooking system. We were able to whip up ramen for everyone in no time. The pot is light and easily fits in any backpack.
review.name: Must have for family backpacking!

review.reviewBody: The non-stick coating peeled off after the first use, I just got it today. Didn't realize it until I cleaned the pot, so I definitely also unintentionally ate anti-stick material. Would not recommend this product.
review.name: Catastrophic Failure

review.reviewBody: Used this on a recent trip to on the Colorado trail.  It was efficient transferring the heat from our optimus vega stove.  Boil times were quick and it was the perfect size to boil enough water for two meals at a time.

This is an excellent pot. Graduated markings on the inside of the pot allow you to accurately measure the water you are adding to heat for specific recipes. Baffles on the bottom of the pot allow for faster heating of your water. In mild weather conditions, I can heat 10 ounces of water in about 90 seconds! The foldout / fold-in handles are amazing and the silicone coating keeps them cool to the touch. The nonstick surface on the inside of the pot makes clean-up a breeze, which is a really handy feature when cooking in the field and you just need cleanup to be a breeze. Inside of the pot, I can easily store my stove, provided windscreen, cleanup sponge, and lighter, allowing me to condense space inside my pack. My only reason for 4 stars instead of 5, is that I'd like to see the lid be locking to the pot and a bit more non-destructive. Perhaps a titanium lid with vents / sight glass. Other than that, this is a pot that if you buy, you will not be disappointed.
review.name: Wonderful Pot for Solo or Dual Cooking!

name: Terra Xpress HE Cook Set
Optimus - FW24 - PDP Videos - OPSH00A - Terra Xpress HE Cook Set

review.reviewBody: Please do not buy these glove liners.  They are very over-priced at $300+.  They don't provide nearly enough warmth to be effective.   And perhaps most importantly,  Hestra customer service is awful.  I wore mine 10-15 times and they quit working entirely.  Hestra was hard to deal with before finally refusing to stand by their product.  A bad company and a waste of money.
review.name: DO NOT BUY THESE LINERS!

review.reviewBody:
These liners barely exhibit any heat and definitely won't do you any good in deep cold conditions. 

First, the heating element can only be felt towards the tips of the fingers. You dont feel much of anything along the length of the fingers, and there's nothing to be felt at all on the back of the hand. There's so little heat, no micro-climate properly builds inside the glove, and ambient cold leeches off the warmth faster than it builds up

Construction was sound, but it takes batteries forever to charge, so dont forget to plug them in. They fit the Hestra Army Leather Heli Ski Glove shell perfectly, both in size 9. I dont recommend this liner at all, and would consider it a waste of money if conditions are below 25F.
review.name: What Heat?

name: Heated Liner

review.reviewBody: Never worked smoothly staoight out of the box failed completely 5 months laters with not many rides. Seems it has an internal cables that stretched out and stopped working always had the grind sensation of not enough lever pull.
review.name: Never worked great out of box

review.reviewBody: This post replaced my Shimano Pro Koryak dropper that developed play very quickly. The PNW Pine I purchased has 20mm more travel and weighs 4 ounces less than the Shimano. Performance has been great, returns to full height quickly with a light top out thud. I'm running the Shimano GRX brake lever with integrated dropper cable so the cable head is at the shifter. To use this dropper I had to modify a cable barrel end to fit in the dropper assembly. It wasn't hard to do and has worked flawlessly.
review.name: Great dropper post!

name: Pine 27.2 Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody: Love these hat, had to get this crazy pink and purple colorway just because it was unique.
review.name: Great hats.

review.reviewBody: I use the hat to keep the hot south Florida sun of my bald head. The hat fits snug and comfortable. The bill is stiffer than previous similar North Face hats, but the materials appear durable, while light and breathable.
review.name: I would buy the hat again hopefully it doesn't change

review.reviewBody: I own three colors of this hat because it looks so good on everyone. I rebuy it all the time to give it away as gifts!!
review.name: Best hat I own!!

review.reviewBody: I prefer to wear low profile caps since I have a smaller head. This fits nicely and the brim is doesn't get in the way when I wear sunglasses. The material is lightweight and breathable. I wear this while running or hiking. I recommend this cap.
review.name: Successful buy

review.reviewBody: Breathable and lightweight just what I was looking for.
review.name: Great color

review.reviewBody: It's lightweight, breathable, and provides good sun protection, making it perfect for hikes or workouts.
review.name: Amazing lightweight hat!

review.reviewBody:
I actually have a different colourway of this hat, so I know that I like the product itself. They don't sell this colourway in the UK, so on a long trip to the US I bought this. It arrived timely, but pretty soon I noticed that the buckle was snapped making it really loose to wear. I'm not sure if this happened during delivery or prior to delivery - but I am really quite sad. I shortly had to come back to the UK, so I haven't contacted the company as I wouldn't be willing to pay for any postage. I really wanted to give 5 stars!

I can either find a generic replacement buckle or apparently North Face could send a replacement. I am open to anything Backcountry suggests
review.name: The hat is great but a broken buckle

review.reviewBody: I have a smaller head so the brim is a little wide but overall comfy and looks good
review.name: Solid hat

review.reviewBody: The adjustment strap on this hat is rather annoying. I don't even have a big head but I gotta adjust the strap some (loosen from factory). After adjusting the size I no longer have enough strap to tuck it back into the hat. So now I got this strap flapping around on the back of my head and I gotta decide if I am gonna cut it off. I own multiple OR hats and they all have enough strap to tuck back into the hat.
review.name: The Adjustment Strap - What's the deal?

review.reviewBody: I have 3 of these hats. Super good at moisture wicking, light weight.
review.name: Awesome hat, wish it came in yellow!!

name: Class V 5 Panel Hat

review.reviewBody: My surgeon recommended these post ankle replacement surgery. They are (and continue to be) supportively effective and comfortable ... like deluxe Crocs.
review.name: Recovery Indeed!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my indoor "slipper" or house shoes to help recover from my broken foot injury. They are great for that purpose and approved by podiatrist. I am am 8.5 so tried the 9 which were too big. Exchanged for 8 which fit but would be perfect if had half sizes.
review.name: Great for the purpose needed

review.reviewBody: Bring back the original style. I purchased at least 15 pairs of the original style. Will not buy these again.
review.name: Not as goo as original

review.reviewBody: I live in Florida and I wear my shoes most of the time. My latest purchase was my 5th pair.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Love the comfort ability however would like a wider version to make my toes lay natural. Imagine a BONDI ORA SLIDE! that would be a hit! I'd buy that but still impressed with my purchase of the Ora slides
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Comfortable only when standing still. Even though they have great cushion and arch support, sizing is true in LENGTH only. These run quite wide. I'm a size 11M and I kick them off accidentally while walking. There is a good .5" of extra space around my foot. No side-to-side support whatsoever. Additionally, the lip on the heel is quite annoying and unnecessary. I'm not even sure why it's there as it serves no purpose beyond being an obstruction to slipping these on with ease. If you have an average to narrow foot and don't like your heel pressing against a lump in your slides, these are not the slides for you.
review.name: Comfortable, but....

review.reviewBody: They are so comfortable I sprained my ankle a year ago and my feet hurt like crazy . No matter what shoes I wear they hurt I put these shoes on they I got them OMG my feet feels like I'm walking on air.
review.name: I LOVE THEM

review.reviewBody: I was so excited to find these slides on sale. I originally ordered a woman's 10, it was very big. Sent it back for a 9: too small. Can't return them. Very sad. I think they run small.
review.name: Sizing off for me

review.reviewBody: I only wear Hoka shoes due to plantar fasciitis and my Dr recommendation. I wear a size 12 men's in every running / walking Hoka shoe model. The recovery slide in a size 12 is HUGE! Definitely size down for better comparison to their running shoes.
review.name: Order a size smaller

review.reviewBody: I ordered the wrong size so they fit my neighbor and he loves them and they fit him perfectly.
review.name: I would buy this product again

name: Ora 3 Recovery Slide

I have seen pictures here of people trying to strap it to the frame... "Saddle bag"

review.reviewBody: Some people have complained about it coming open and losing items. If it’s rolled up correctly it isn’t an issue. That said it’s not super easy to roll up if on the go or in a group race/ride. This weekend I was able to access the items inside east enough, but after a quick flat fix, it was easier and quicker to just throw the seat roll into my CamelBak than it was to re-fold/roll/attach -if it were one of my other seat packs, i’d have undoubtedly just re-attached the Velcro connection and rode on. -I noted that it runs small, because it does fit a tube/multi-tool/patch/tire levers/spare links/CO2, having all that makes it tough to fold down/attach properly.
review.name: No big issues

review.reviewBody: If you like to stop every 15 minutes because your saddle bag gets loose and tangle from your seat, this is your ideal bag. I tried to set it every imaginable way, but with any vibration from the road, it will get loose. And you potentially will loose your stuff. If I could give it 0 stars I will do. 50$ thrown to the garbage.
review.name: Absolutely Garbage

review.reviewBody: This is a great looking bag, but it unwraps every off every ride and stuff falls out. I am mainly riding gravel or single track. I pack it up with a tube, tire irons, multi tool and CO2. It fits great and simple to attach to seat post or tube. The boa dial is super simple. I found if I really torque it down it fails less under my seat post. Really torque it down. I would only recommend for road or smooth surfaces use.
review.name: Looks great! Better for road.

review.reviewBody: Nothing more to add. Was this item designed but not tested? Fell off on mile 10.
review.name: I wish I read the reviews first

review.reviewBody: DO NOT BUY IT. You will have to stop 3, 4, 5....10 times while riding to put it back in place. It keeps fallings. Absolutely garbage.
review.name: Absolutely garbage

review.reviewBody:
Poor design and comes off every ride. While waiting to sort out a return or a new bag, I've taken to lashing it to my handlebars, and it still comes loose when I hit a bump. It fits my components but too many times, I've had to pick up all of them over a few hundred yards when it falls off my bike.

The previous version of this seat roll doesn't seem to have these problems, but I seem to have a similar experience to most other reviewers here.
review.name: Terrible. Falls off every ride.

review.reviewBody:
I was hoping to improve my under the seat bag by purchasing this item.  I was wrong, this is a poor design and it will NOT stay in place no matter how you do it.  Here is the funniest/worst part of the whole story, the absolute worst part about this bag (for me) was the extra large rubber pull tab, because on every bumpy decent it would flap and hit the bag making the worst slapping noise I have ever heard!!! The concept looked promising, the price was on the high side, so I thought it would be a quality item.  It might be good quality, but it is useless as a saddle bag. 
I hope when I reach out to the company they will allow me to make a return, because I'm way past the 30 return policy from Backcountry.
review.name: This thing is worthless!

review.reviewBody: I like the concept, but Ive had tons of issues with the BOA. It just doesn't have enough grip to cinch down the roll to the saddle, so it regularly comes loose during longer rides.
review.name: the BOA isnt good enough

review.reviewBody:
I cannot recommend this unfortunately. It just does not stay cinched up and always ends up dangling around. Very disappointing. 
Quick follow up. It mostly works without issue on the road bike.
review.name: Fail from Silca
comment: I have the same problem. I believe this happens because the Boa system is offset on the bag toward the front. I've used three times on gravel and each time the bag falls off despite cranking it as tight as it goes. I've turned the bag around to stop this but it doesn't look as nice under the saddle.

name: Seat Roll Asymmetrico
